interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Type.ServerAuthentication.DRAFT
interface.tp:docstring: The type for a channel representing an authentication step with the server. The actual authentication functionality is implemented by additional interfaces, such as Channel.Interface.SaslAuthentication.DRAFT, depending on the value of AuthenticationMethod.

property.name: AuthenticationInformation
property.tp:docstring: Dictionary of information given by the CM which can be used by the handler for authentication.

property.name: AuthenticationMethod
property.tp:docstring: This property defines the method used for the current authentication step. The functionality for each method is on a separate interface on the same channel; for example, channels with this property set to Authentication_Type Sasl MUST implement Channel.Interface.SaslAuthentication.DRAFT.

tp:docstring.p: An extensible map representing details provided by the server for authentication. Well-known keys, along with the type expected in the corresponding value:

dl.dd: Username to authenticate with, if needed
Realm to use for authentication, if needed
XMPP session id, as needed for the legacy jabber digest method.

tp:member.name: Key
tp:member.tp:docstring: A key for a detail, which SHOULD be one of the well-known keys, if possible.
